A Routed_transmission_line is a type of
and a type of
included where the explicit layout pattern is a design property and where the requirements are consistent along a path. The terminals are inherited from .

specifies the role of the
for the Routed_transmission_line.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Routed_transmission_line. The derived_from provides a cross-sectional definition that shall be interpreted as a constant cross-section along the path of the route.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Routed_transmission_line. The routed_centreline_shape may be represented as the result of an extrusion process, where the derived_from is extruded along the path of the route. The ends of the shape shall be perpendicular to the centreline.
ext_description.note: This representation is not intended to reflect physical processing.

for the Routed_transmission_line.

or a

A Printed_component is an occurrence of
that is used as an
in an . A Printed_component is manufactured integral to an . Only the
subtype shall reference a
as a .

note.p:
and
are provided for the most common case of CAD system interface requirements. Printed_component other than
are generally reserved for more complex requirements.

ext_description.note: The cad_layer is only appropriate where there is a single layer material being defined.

ext_description.p: A Printed_component_join_terminal is a type of . This terminal is a terminus for internal circuitry in the interconnect substrate.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows the internal terminals of the printed connector (edge connector).

figure.title: Printed connector component and associated terminals

A Printed_connector_component is a type of . The Printed_connector_component is the occurrence of a . The purpose of the Printed_connector_component is to provide access to the assembly in which the interconnect substrate, that the realized connector is part of, is installed.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_connector_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_connector_component as its . There shall be one or more Printed_connector_component_interface_terminals for a Printed_connector_component.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Printed_connector_component.

ext_description.p: A Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal is a type of . The Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal is an individual access mechanism (e.g., one terminal on a ). "Interface" means it is not tied to the substrate as part of the fabrication or assembly operation.

example.p: Figure 2 of ISO/TS 10303-1737 illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows a Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Printed_connector_component_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p:
A Tiebar_printed_component is a type of
and a type of . The function of a Tiebar_printed_component is to provide a short between two or more physical networks. A Tiebar_printed_component provides a realization mechanism to resolve the logical difficulty in having contiguous metalization on a layer while still making an assertion that there is more than one physical network associated with the metalization.
ext_description.note: Because of the predefined function of the Tiebar_printed_component, the logical structure associated with each of the physical networks shorted by a Tiebar_printed_component continues to exist in the design model.

The set of
input to
to generate the tiebar_component is prefiltered to qualify only the types desired which is the
and none of it's subtypes and no complex instances with other subtypes of .

If a tiebar functionality is needed but the functionality of the short is not realized as part of the fabrication process but is realized as part of an external component then
shall be provided instead of Tiebar_printed_component.
A Tiebar_printed_component may be used to provide a thermal short in addition to an electrical short, depending on material characteristics.
ext_description.example: A standard example is for two ground signals to be tied together in a single small neighborhood of points but retain their internal structure for design and analysis purposes. This example is referenced in industrial practice as a single point ground practice.
An industrial application of a Tiebar_printed_component may be to ensure higher levels of reliability by forcing localized measurements to be generated by automated inspection algorithms.

ext_description.p: There shall be at least one member of tiebar_component or there shall be at least one member of passage_component.
ext_description.note:
A Tiebar_printed_component may just be implemented as a
which connects implementation of two or more
on at least two different
and therefore does not use an
to effect the short circuit.

ext_description.p: Only tiebar_component and padstack_component are allowed to be components.
There shall be at least one padstack_component that is not a passage_component.
ext_description.note:
At least one padstack_component will be a
so as to implement horizontal interface to the material on a .
ext_description.example:
In the case where an inner layer is to be connected, a
would be a padstack_component.

from any other tiebar_component.

If exactly one passage_component is provided, then if there is a tiebar_component provided, the
of the tiebar_component shall be in the vertical extent of the passage_component.

If more than one passage_component is provided, then the
of each member of tiebar_component shall be in the vertical extent of each of the passage_component.
